website_summaries.verdict: While some folks may encounter come comfort issues, the Velodyne vPulse in-ear headphones offer excellent sound for the money and will particularly appeal to bass lovers.
pros: The Velodyne vPulse in-ear headphones offer very good sound, highlighted by impressive bass response
They also have a distinct design and have an inline microphone/remote for Apple iOS product users
cons: The earphones aren't supercomfortable and may not fit everyone equally well
the inline remote will not function with most non-Apple smartphones

customer_reviews.title: Best earbuds I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: These are really good earbuds. I was able to hear the line noise of my MacBook Pro they were so good. They aren't immune from the sound you hear with almost all earbuds when the cable is bumped. They stay in my ears well when I'm sitting still, but tend to slide out when I'm up and about. The noise isolation is great. So great that when I wear them at work and have music playing at a normal, non-damaging level, people have to make ridiculous motions to catch my eye. It's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Givens

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for the BUCK with AWESOME BASS
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are wonderful; probably the best bang for the buck if you enjoy clear sound and bass. I love clearly defined sound and I try out almost all earbuds due to the fact that I wear them out or I'll lose them. I have bought most everything, from Shure to Klipsch, and these are right up there among the best of them. Actually, I enjoy these more than the Klipsch and just as much as the Shure(which are a tad more clear) except the bass is more prominent with the Velodyne vPluse, in my opinion, and they're much less expense than the comparable Shure model. If you want great sound inexpensively, I highly recommend these earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Gilmore III

customer_reviews.title: Sound awesome...but comfort and fit not so much
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful as they sound great, a lot of bass but in a good way. Not distorted and doesn't drown out the other sounds. As for the comfort I've tried all the different sized tips and just can't get a perfect combo. They always seem to start to hurt after about a couple hours...and I constantly find myself having to push them back in my ear, but when I first put them in my ears, it's an awesome experience as they really block outside noise even with low volume. But within 5-10 minutes they slowly start working their way out and it does become annoying. I'll still be searching for a better pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod L. McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, especially the low end, seems to have the extra octave of true tight bass, not boomy or woofy. They sound better with a couple of db knocked down in the 4-8 khz region with the graphic eq in the PowerAmp player on my Android phone. Inline remote is really designed for Apple stuff not Android and doesn't control the music player although the center button does answer a phone call and place one. Nice build quality. I do like the flat linguine style cables, they don't get tangled up so much. Good selection of 4 different sizes of rubber earpieces. Very happy I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good bass, tight sealing, right headphone broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty happy with Velodyne vPulse headphones when I got them a month ago. Overall sound was not as loud as some of my other headphones. But they had tight sealing and good bass. I used them during my commute to work and they isolated background noise pretty well. After one month of gentle use right headphone stopped working. Luckily I still had a few days before 30 days return policy expiration. Velodyne provide warranty only for items bought from authorized sellers. Make sure that you buy it from authorized seller.
customer_reviews.author: Viktar Karpach

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone, not good for exercise
customer_reviews.text: This headphone has great bass and that's about it. If you love bass these are perfect for it. However, I wouldn't recommend buying this for the gym. I gave this product 3 stars for the following reasons. 1)Static noise when moving (Really irritating) 2)Ear buds fall off during exercise (The microphone/volume control's excessive weight drags it out of ear) 3)Ear buds doesn't fit that well despite different sizes that came with the headphones
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bass! more than my Monster Turbine and ATH-M50
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bass! more than my Monster Turbine and ATH-M50. Quality of bass is superb, clean, long, deep like a really good woofer in my car. mid and high is 8/10. Not as good as some high end earbuds, but bass beats them all. I usually pick earphones for good vocals, but picked this for its good price, end up really fun listening to it. Quality of construction/materials not as high as seinnheiser, Monster, beats but still pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Lee

customer_reviews.title: These headphones work perfect for my 45 minute commute to work on mass ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones work perfect for my 45 minute commute to work on mass transit. The sound is pretty good. The sound isn't as good as my over the ears Ultrasone headphones, but I wouldn't expect them to be as good. The bass is about perfect for me, but the mids are a bit missing. The headphones fit well. I wish the headphones came with a hard sided case. They come with a soft pouch which doesn't offer much protection. Overall these were a good buy and I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, awful built quality
customer_reviews.text: These Velodyne headphones only lasted two months. I never stepped on them, never submerged them in any liquid, and never violently pulled from me ears. These headphones are just poorly built. I contacted customer service and asked if I could get a replacement, Velodyne responded with a yes, however I must return the damaged headphones and I must pay for the shipping. Sorry Velodyne, you just lost a client.
customer_reviews.author: Angélica Ibáñez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bass, great mids and highs! Bass is punchy but also clear and not overwhelming. They are cheaper and sound better than the higher prices headphones. They fall out occasionally but that doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Dimas Ojeda

customer_reviews.title: Its all about the bass
customer_reviews.text: OMG that bass! These are the best in-ear headphones I've ever tried. You can compare the highs and mids to other headphones but the bass surpasses them all. I combined it with a FiiO 6 amplifier to get better highs and mids and it rocks the headphones without distortion. My first headphone stopped working the in-line controller. And although I made the buy from an unofficial seller, Velodyne was kind enough to apply the warranty and get me new headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but not durable enough for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months! Better sound than klipsch s4a's. Randomly the mic stopped working one day. Earbuds still work but not the mic. Meanwhile my 1+ year old S4a-II's are working, even though the cheap plastic mic case fell apart is now held together with duct tape. I was hoping these would be a little more durable than the klipsch, but i am disappointed. Nothing visibly looks broken so I might try to take apart the mic case to see if i can repair them. I usually get around 2 year of life from my earbuds so i will be going back to my janky s4a's until my budget allows an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D.

customer_reviews.title: But mids and treble are straight up bad. Also
customer_reviews.text: These sound decent. Bass is incredible for the price. But mids and treble are straight up bad. Also, they broke on me after a year. You should step it up to the ~$100 price range and you'll find something that sounds a lot better and will last a lot longer
customer_reviews.author: GRFTY-P

customer_reviews.title: Good bass earbuds for the price
customer_reviews.text: Clear sound and really decent bass. I liked these until one of them popped open after a year of use. After that happened and I pooped it back together the volume in the one side was reduced 75%, making them practically useless. They must be filled with gas or something that if released make them lose their effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Berberich

customer_reviews.title: Hits most of the marks.
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are replacing an old pair of Shures which I liked, but which crapped out after the 5 years I used 'em. Fair enough. The Velodynes are recommended by The Wirecutter. Do you need any more reason to get them? They hit most of the marks: - Sound is audiophile good-enough - Cord design reduces tangle - Build quality is solid Only downside for me is fit. The small rubber bits are too small and the mediums are slightly too big, meaning I have to periodically push them back in to get a good seal. Not so bad that I get annoyed, but enough that I feel compelled to mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C. Latkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price, but earbuds prone to slip out of my ears
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality, especially the bass, is quite good for the price range these headphones came at. The cord is very sturdy and I haven't had any problems with it unlike many headphones I've owned in the past. My one gripe is that in-ear earbuds seem to fall out fairly easily. While they work great at sound and noise isolation while sitting at a desk, if I am trying to exercise they slide out of my ears quite commonly. I have tried all of the different sizes of earbuds that come with the headphones, finding the largest to work the best, but it isn't perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Yanofsky

customer_reviews.title: Best portable headphones I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a bunch of headphones for my iphone and nothing beats the quality of these. Rich bass and nice mids and highs, perfect for Electronic music. The only issue I have is that the in ear design really isolates outside noise much more than I expected. That's fine if you're on a plane or crowded environment looking to do that, but walking the streets in an Urban environment can be challenging if you turn up the volume too high. Regardless- I love them so much that I'm pretty sure I've lost them after two months of use and plan to order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: thesheemer

customer_reviews.title: I used the Radian brand and it works great. Just about the closest you can get to ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this along with DIY ear plug kit. I used the Radian brand and it works great. Just about the closest you can get to Audiology custom fit ones. They did however stop working for some reason and the replacement method by manufacturer was great and I received a updated model at no charge !
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Mccurdy

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones. Perhaps it's because of the shape of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good headphones. Perhaps it's because of the shape of my ear, but they stay in while I'm active, the sound quality is excellent, and they are a substantial improvement over the Apple headphones they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: cavmpc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: The Velodyne vPulse In-Ear Headphones are reasonably comfortable, and afford pleasant sound, that extends down to the bottom octave of even classical music. Most listeners do not need to spend more than the $89 cost of the vPulse. These come in a nice, compact case. They come with a range of different-sized soft ear sleeves. I ended up using the next to largest size.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M. Birnbaum

customer_reviews.title: My new go to earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up and paired them with a sansa clip. If you like bass these are for you. I prefer them over my Monster Turbines. After almost 40 hours of play time im happy with these. I use the supplied ear pieces and they fit me just fine. Treble isn't overpowering and the bass is strong but doesn't drown out mids.
customer_reviews.author: G.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These in-ear headphones sounded amazing and for the amount of abuse i put them through I'm totally happy with how long they lasted. Check them out you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Smith

customer_reviews.title: Recommended with Issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ear buds to replace a pair of Bose IE2 ear buds with position stabilizers. The Bose ear buds seem to never drop out, even when exercising, but the sound quality was poor. (If there's no highs or lows it must be Bose) The fit of the Velodyne ear buds is good but after 30 minutes or so they begin to irritate (as most in-ear buds do). The sound is very good (for ear buds) and the bass is strong, but there is a noticeable cable thump. Basically if you are sitting still and listening to the Veldynes then I can recommend them. If you are going to be exercising you might want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LLeyton

customer_reviews.title: An Audiophile Headphone, Music as you want it to be
customer_reviews.text: It is comfy, and the sound puts all others to shame unless you spend three times the amount to get an equivalent headphone. It takes great sound to please me as my over the ear headphones are the bose and Fostex TH600. So, for me to be satisfied with an in-ear set takes alot. These Velodyne deliver music in a full rich sense. I was pleased with them as they exceeded my expectations. Music as you want it to be.
customer_reviews.author: hrh

customer_reviews.title: I tried a lot of headphones and none were even ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried a lot of headphones and none were even close to the bass quality of these. Surprisingly, the closest ones I tested were actually the standard Apple ear buds. However, these blow all the others I tried away for the price range $20-$100. The mic and volume buttons actually were compatible with my iPhone (several others weren't). Only minor drawback is the cord is rather heavy - after getting a little sweaty during running, they tend to slip out of your ears. But all the other qualities more than make up for that minor flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Walter S. Langkau

customer_reviews.title: Love these. After the tips fell off my Bose ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. After the tips fell off my Bose headphones yet again, I decided to try something new. Sound is gorgeous through these. Super sturdy, no issues with tips falling off.
customer_reviews.author: W.L.

customer_reviews.title: If you can catch them for under 50$ they are worth it
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on these headphones are amazing and if you can get them for under 50$ like I did they are definately worth it. Unfortunately I ended up returning them because I'm not a big fan of in-ear buds. For me they kept popping out of my ear when I was walking. I will say though compared to other in-ear headphones, these where extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Nasti

customer_reviews.title: Short Lived Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Do not get these useless headphones. Yes, they sounded great for the first sing I listened to but the right bud stopped working by the second freaking song. No joke. They lasted a total of 3 minutes before breaking. I will never purchase anything from Velodyne again. I suggest you avoid these headphones if you don't like wasting your money.
customer_reviews.author: Reed C

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year's use
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I bought the headphones in June 2012 and I am sorry to say less than a year later they have broken down on me. The wire attaching to the right speaker has come off and will require soldering if I am to use them again. I never went running or done any extreme activities, they were in use mainly listening to music at the office or when flying. For a pair of headphones costing almost $100 I'd expect to get more use out of them. When they did work I was satisfied with the sound, the fit was a bit questionable but that part veries from person to person. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: vichentie milea

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! Lows are good. Highs are good. Well balanced
customer_reviews.author: Supersport1

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I've ever owned. My 1st pair was stolen after having them only 1 month. I immediately ordered another pair. I can run with them, I use them on a plane for long periods. I couldn't be happier with them.
customer_reviews.author: W. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Decent but could be better
customer_reviews.text: These headphones really do have amazing bass. The problem is that the bass drowns out any of the high notes. The treble sounds almost muted because the bass is so heavy. If you really want a bass headphone, these are the way to go. I originally had a pair of Klipsch S4 and they were amazingly balanced. If I had to order again, I would go again with the Klipsch because of the sound quality. Again, these aren't bad headphones, but my Klipsch were better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Price! Outstanding Bass! Mids n Highs could be jus a bit brighter...
customer_reviews.text: Nice price!! Excellent bass with my Sony Walkman NW-ZX1. Sony Walkman makes them punch a bit more. Decent bass with my Apple iPod 4th gen. Highs and mids arent as good as my Klipsch earbuds, but im more of a bass type of guy. ((( 0_o )))
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: D.O.A.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to hear these because the set I got ended up being D.O.A. (dead on arrival) the right side wouldn't work at all. However, they did look pretty nice and are definitely a strong and solid ear bud. Obviously, I had to return them, but that process has been pretty easy and painless.
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: Best bass in any earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I've tried monster, sol republic, and kiplisch earbuds. If you are looking for earbuds with bass this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: A. Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through several pairs of ear buds of the last couple of years including Bose and Klipsch. These are by far the best. I did have to change the tips to get the right fit but once i had the right ones in i was amazed on how good they were. Not only is the sound awesome the wires themselves don't tangle up. If you are looking for a pair of ear buds under $100 and you are picky about sound quality, you have found them.. These rock, literally.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: They sound great, but now
customer_reviews.text: Received these earbuds on July 28th. They sound great, but now, after less than 3 months, they're showing their true colors. First, the mic started working so I could no longer make calls whilst wearing the headphones. Secondly, the plastic around the stem is starting to tear. exposing the wiring. I don't do anything beyond normal use. I've tried to contact the seller from whom I've bought them, but I've yet to hear anything. Sucks.
customer_reviews.author: scott wilson

customer_reviews.title: Search for the right earphone tips!
customer_reviews.text: When I got the earphones and I made my first hearing test, I was heavily disappointed: Where's the bass? The Sound was not more than average. After some days, I changed the earphone tips and a miracle happened: Strong, clear bass and a overwhelming sound! So try the attached tips and select the one, which is best for you and you will be surprised!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Best in-ear headset yet
customer_reviews.text: Although they are just slightly larger than most in-ear headsets, the performance is tremendously improved over others. Price is reasonable for the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Customer X

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Being a bass lover I cannot recommed these. Even burned them in for 36 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Harsh sound
customer_reviews.text: Advertized as excellent bass, instead I find the upper register to B more prominent. . . to the point of harshness. So I'm disappointed. Quality build however.
customer_reviews.author: Maxie

customer_reviews.title: Deep bass and solid treble
customer_reviews.text: Good earphones. Fit inside ears a little awkwardly but changed buds and now they are somewhat better!
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding .....
customer_reviews.text: These are the best in ear phones that I've ever used; and I've used my share of them.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Trombone

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good cost/benefit. Not for audiophiles, but pretty decent sound for everyday shenanigans.
customer_reviews.author: femiz

customer_reviews.title: Highs are absent
customer_reviews.text: When buying these I understood they would be bass heavy, but the lack of treble was far worse than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Becker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: First headphones I've ever used that come remotely close to by 140db subwoofer setup in my car. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Love the impact bass tones make for music. Also a better wire system that avoids tangles and proves easier to keep organized.
customer_reviews.author: mburris

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great but didn't last more than 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an alternative to the Bose® MIE2i (which had finally broke after 3 times in the washer). THe sound was great, when you were not moving. If you were walking or doing any other type of activity, the "in ear" design seemed to make noises - not noticeable when the volume is up, but bothersome when the volume was low. After about 7 months, the wires became exposed on the left earphone. A few days later the left earphone stopped working. 2 days later I bought a new set of Bose® MIE2i.
customer_reviews.author: Oskar Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones but broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved these headphones. Bass was just fine for me. I love listening to alternative rock and some hip hop and these were proving to be my best headphone purchase. Mic and remote was an additional benefit. But these headphones died on me just after my return window had closed. The right bud wasnt responding at all. I couldn't return these (seller refused to take them back) neither could I use these. I am still giving these 2 starts because I loved their sound quality while it was working.
customer_reviews.author: IvsavNera

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the only thing with these headphone is you can't eat with them in your ears, you won't be able to hear anything.
customer_reviews.author: nestor martin

customer_reviews.title: JUS DOOO IT!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: They have a nice sound(good bass), and they lasted me a lot longer than previously brands I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Vega

customer_reviews.title: Good ear buds at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Good ear buds at a good price. Nice sound for the price, emphasis on the bass. My only con was finding the right buds to fit my ears but that's not a fault of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Magbanua

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great and comfortable. Major step up from the cheep ones I purchased at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: sdpatch

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I've bought the vPulse. Lost the first one and bought another one immediately. Great bass, acceptable mids and highs... Excellent for action movies.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Soong

customer_reviews.title: Sound awesome, but construction could be better
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great sounding and have an awesome amount of bass. One of the ear buds came apart though, and the volume & play buttons stopped working. I'm going to be getting them repaired and giving them another go though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good bass/sound but earbud stopped working 6 months later
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed the sound of these earbuds--I really like bass and these earbuds deliver bass very well. That said, 6 months later and my left earbud randomly shorted out. :(
customer_reviews.author: amalia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. A little bit of "squishy" noises with ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. A little bit of "squishy" noises with the in ear buds, and doesn't stay in my ear extremely well when running or eating, but overall pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: wb

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these buds is great, but they do not stay in place for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Light

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy listening to these earphones. If I had to critique them I would suggest some over the ear support because they tend to fall out when working out. The sound is great when they sit in your ear correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Castro

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphone! I tried many such as beats audio or head-go reZeros and I have to say this headphone packs amazing highs and mids. Almost as good as reZeros. The lows are incredible. You can hear the loud subwoofer like sound in each bass. I listen to a lot of hip hop and electronic music (dubstep) and its perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: Btran

customer_reviews.title: not velodyne or amazons fault.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was terrible. Upon further inspection I found out the headphones I was sent were not real velodyne vpulses but a lookalike scam. I called amazon and they worked with me to settle the inconvenience very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Joran McGregor

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: For some, these may be tough to get a fit that's comfortable and sounds good. But, with multiple sizes of caps to choose from, it's worth the work. Best low-end sound I've heard from earbud-style headphones. No peakiness in mid- and upper ranges either. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Sturdy enough to withstand a bearing at the gym, easily untangles, and great bass response. Best headphones I've owned, reasonably price. Definitely greater value than Beats!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome!! Like the design, powerful bass, and good audio quality. Way better than my beats tour which is like 50 bucks for expensive.
customer_reviews.author: LEE K.

customer_reviews.title: Unblievable sound!
customer_reviews.text: Best pair I've ever owned and durable. Bass and clarity is off the chart. Can change the sound and song without reaching for your ipod!
customer_reviews.author: mbauncp

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding earphone, love the bass and everything about it except its durability. My first pair stopped working working in 10 months, called Velodyne and they sent replacement in few days. Great service. After 10 months, 2nd pair right side suddenly stop working out. I called Velodyne one more time but they did not honor my warranty since this earphone bought more than a year ago. I am out of luck this time. Buyer, you have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Denoxster

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality.  Cord needs to be longer.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound especially low end. If the overall headphone cable was another six inches longer it would be much better in a typical gym clothes setting.
customer_reviews.author: William C McGirr

customer_reviews.title: If you want headphones that sound good the first couple times you use them then these ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want headphones that sound good the first couple times you use them then these are great, but if you want something that will last for more than a week get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love the bass these headphones have. fits nicely. wires are on a heavy side and clip does not hold both wires. but overall love this product - noise cancelling works great even when mowing the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: rajanishr

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Sound was ok, but the ear buds often fell out. The connection at the base broke after 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lisette Isenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent sound, comfy to wear. I like the "flat" cord, they don't get tangled as easily as other brands do.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvie Thrush Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great set of headphones. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! The bass is fantastic and the sound is awesome! I recommend for every one who's looking for quality and price. It's way better than beats.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel de Melo Martins Junior

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Only complaint is that even with 3 sizes of buds, I need to keep pushing them back in.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Velodyne vPulse Black In-Ear Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Top quality with very good sound for ear buds. Base is better than typical buds. Would recommend this. Nice appointments with high quality carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: good sound , but regret buying
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good , probably a bit more bass heavy than I would like. They do run very loud at top volume compared to my previous earphones (Shure 215). My gripes with these are the connector and the cord. Connection to iPhone isn't snug , so a slight movement takes away the remote control and mic connection. The lead , whilst a novelty to not have them tangled, is long and obtrusive. In summary, I wish I bought the Shure 215 again .. I lost my last pair
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Clear mids & highs. Strong bass.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound--bass is very present As all isolater headphones are, the fit & comfort need to be just right. It takes time to dial them in, but the silicone tips of various sizes do the job. These headphones are more suited to sitting & enjoying your music ( on a plane or at a desk or standing up). Walking, exercising, or moving too much eliminates the fit & sound quality. Flat cord design is brilliant & decreases the tangles. Remote is in a good place & the buttons logical to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: JETCarpentry

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones EVER
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the best headphones I have ever used in my life, totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff... Really enjoying them.. Long cables and they really don't tangle.. Bass is extraordinary for ear plugs.. Got them on time
customer_reviews.author: Dbone888

customer_reviews.title: Velodyne vPulse
customer_reviews.text: Great bass response. Excellent value for the price. Like the Inline Mic control. Works with my iPhone 5. Fits my odd shaped ears well.
customer_reviews.author: The Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Best under $100 earphones I have found
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sounding headphones. Good bass response for an in-ear headphone. See the the audiophiliac's review on C-Net for a much better description of their performance. These earphones are the best valiue I have found in the under $100 category. The only thing that stops me from giving them a 5 star rating are the controls. The version of the controls that came with my pair have a volume toggle switch with a slightly raised rectangle in the middle for pause\skip\replay. It is very difficult to find the middle of the switch without looking at the control. The apple earphones are much better in this regard as they have an indentation in the middle that is easily found by touch.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: the deep bass is incredible
customer_reviews.text: fits well, sounds great and value for money. Better than a lot of expensive ones out there. totally love them
customer_reviews.author: rishi

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: While the music sounds are very good, the phone audio is lacking. Very often, the person on the other end is asking what I said which makes me guess the microphone cuts out. Most disappointing though is these earphones have a nasty flaw where the volume increases to full blast on its own at random times which is both annoying and uncomfortable. I wish Shure didn't discontinue the set that I like as I'd buy those again. Maybe I got a defective set of earphones here but I do not recommend these, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Ayres

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you have an I-phone
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a week, and they might go back. First, I should have read the fine print--the microphone only works on the Iphone. I have a windows phone so I cannot use them for phone calls. Sound quality--is good, but I wouldn't say the bass is "throbbing." Also, about the headphones going out--the jury is out on this one. When I first got these I thought I heard a crackle in one of the headphones. So far so good now, but if the headphone goes out, I'll modify this to 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: schuan carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been really happy with the quality until last week the right ear bud kept coming detached from the base. I glued it back on, but now I have no sound in the right bud. Good sound when they do work and fit in the ear nicely. Good for working out
customer_reviews.author: andrew cuffel

customer_reviews.title: Defective ?
customer_reviews.text: The sound from these was so tinny, so completely lacking in bass, I have to think these were defective ; will return immediately. I have been using earbuds that came with a Creative MP3 player purchased 6 or so years ago, and have yet to hear sound that can top them.
customer_reviews.author: Bluenote

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: these are nowhere near worth the price. Bass is lacking, don't go very loud, voice seems to come mainly from left earplug, the ear pieces appear to be a cheap plastic, cord isn't very long, my advice is to go with Skull Candy Titans. The sound is definitely supreme and $30 cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, atrocious fit
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound of the vpulse headphones. I have been using Klipsch S4i for the past year, and for the same price i think Vpulse has better clarity and the lows are much more distinct. that being said i cant get them to stay in my ears. No matter which size tip i use, i am constantly fidgeting with them to get a good seal. Needless to say its an never ending battle that i always lose. That is when i am sitting down, its impossible to get great sound when i am walking around. I love the sound of these headphones, but the fit is bad enough that i have gone back to my Klipsch set.
customer_reviews.author: Dcsleez

customer_reviews.title: Good but uncomfortable great with comply tips
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has a sub woofer connected to everything I listen to music or watch movies on, these headphones are perfect, my only complaint was that they are very uncomfortable with the tips they come with I would highly recommend the t-400 comply headphone tip's to make these headphones amazing. Once i got the comply tips i have nothing but praise for these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R.

customer_reviews.title: Love the bass!
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out which ear buds to use I noticed a great increase in base. The only issue is that I can hear the cords move when the music volume is low.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Richards II

customer_reviews.title: Favorite headphones ever, but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: These were one of my favorite purchases of all time. I'm not an audiophile, but I definitely appreciate good sound and to me these were the best sounding headphones I've ever heard. I seriously considered buying a second pair just in case I ever lost the originals. Unfortunately, after 5 months of use (with very good care) they now crackle with the slightest bit of movement. It's very sad to me, as they were my favorite. I might end up buying another pair, even with the expectation they'll only last 6 months, because I miss the sound quality so much.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I like it with a complaint
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good but when I'm chewing I hear static in the left side. Only when I'm chewing. Kinda weird maybe it's my ear. I don't know. Sounds good when I'm not moving my mouth...
customer_reviews.author: Kyu

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, didn't fit me well
customer_reviews.text: Great sound all around. Love the shape of the cords and the earpieces. But like many others have stated, it was hard to find one of the included earpiece attachments that fit my ear canal properly. If I'm sitting still it's pretty good, but these fall out if I'm wearing them while moving about.
customer_reviews.author: Janus1172

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Got mine and they worked for about 40 seconds until the right speaker became spotty and eventually stopped working altogether. I'm going to return and presumably have better luck but judging on the reviews here it seems this is not too uncommon of a case.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but depends what you listen to
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones overall but if your a bass head and listening to techno look for another brand
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.  Unreliable/poor microphone.
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after 5 months of daily use traveling to/from work in NYC subway... Less than an hour of use per day. These were not abused but nevertheless the cord is breaking down at the jack connection and the left speaker no longer works. The microphone proved unreliable shortly after purchase as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Velodyne
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the cost. Excellent bass and very good mid and top end. Better than many of the higher priced headphones
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Defective ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these. When they work, they seem to work well. But like others posted here, the ones I received were defective, producing almost no sound in the right ear bud.
customer_reviews.author: Upstart Crow

customer_reviews.title: Forms a seal at ear canal - not a fan of that myself.
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. I don't like headphones that form a complete seal at the ear canal and these ones do. Sent them back and went back to my old Bose Headphones.
customer_reviews.author: A S

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound but easily falls off
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound. Although it falls off easily. Bass is ok. A little bit expensive for the price but it is what it is
customer_reviews.author: Carlo T. Palarca

product_meta.title: Velodyne vPulse in-Ear Headphones (Classic Black)
product_meta.description: The vPulse in-ear headphones combine a secure fit with outstanding sound quality, making them the ideal choice for music and mobile calls whenever you want, wherever you go. The vPulse in-ear headphones feature precise, low-distortion audio quality due to its 10 mm driver and aluminum housing. Intuitive in-line controls also provide options for mobile phone calls, music playback and volume levels. The headphone's combination of advanced design, features and superior audio quality allow for hours of comfort and an overall incredible listening experience.
feature_bullets: Noise reducing in-ear headphones create an all encompassing listening experience
Unique design made with quality materials ensures longevity
Multiple sized ear tips allow a consistent and comfortable fit during activities
A thicker, stronger vPulse cable minimizes those annoying, messy tangles
vPulse cable features intuitive phone, playback and volume controls

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars197 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
